section.p: The software and setup utilities are distributed in the installation package on the DVD. To set up the installation package, you have to mount the DVD and execute the setup.sh script that is provided. It extracts the utilities required for installing .

ol.li: Log in to the Control Machine.

li.p: Mount the DVD to a directory of your choice. It is recommended that you explicitly specify the ISO9660 file system.
Replace <file_name> by the file name of the device and <mount_dir> by the directory to which you want to mount the DVD.

Replace <mount_dir> by the directory to which you have mounted the DVD.

section.p: The content of the installation package is extracted to the /opt/FJSVsvcmm directory on the Control Machine. After extraction, the following files and directories are available:

li.p: Directory with the Ansible group variables required for configuring the Control Machine from which is installed.
Directory with the Ansible host variables required for configuring the Control Machine from which is installed.
Directories with artifacts required by the installer.
Directory with sample Ansible configuration files. They can be used for configuring the Control Machine from which is installed.
Ansible playbooks required for installing and uninstalling the software components.
Script for starting, stopping, and viewing the status of the agents and services.

13_PythonRequirements.txt lists the Python libraries required for the Monitoring Service, OSP8_PythonRequirements.txt lists the Python libraries required for the OpenStack extensions. These libraries are installed to the /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages directory.
li.note: As a prerequisite for the Monitoring Service and the OpenStack extensions, specific versions of the Python libraries must be installed. Make sure that the installed versions are not overwritten in the /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages directory.
li.p: 13_RPMPackages.txt lists the RPM (RedHat Repository Manager) packages required for installing the components. OSP8_RPMPackages.txt lists the RPM packages required for installing the OpenStack extensions.
li.note: The installer automatically installs any missing RPM packages from your YUM repository server. You have to ensure that the required packages are available in your YUM repository.
